recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
In a pan, sauté the diced pancetta or guanciale until crispy. Add minced garlic and cook briefly.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano, and Parmesan cheese. Season with black pepper.
Combine the cooked spaghetti with the pancetta mixture. Remove from heat and quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta. Toss well to coat.
Serve immediately, garnished with chopped fresh parsley.

recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into strips
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season the chicken strips with salt and black pepper.
In a skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until no longer pink. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and cook briefly. Pour in the heavy cream and grated Parmesan cheese. Stir until the sauce thickens.
Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and simmer for a few minutes.
Serve the chicken Alfredo over the cooked fettuccine. Garnish with chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Classic Margherita Pizza
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough into a thin round crust.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Arrange the sliced mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly, about 10-12 minutes.
Remove from the oven, top with fresh basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and black pepper.

recipes.title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, minced garlic, brown sugar, cornstarch, and sesame oil to make the sauce.
Heat cooking oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add the thinly sliced flank steak and stir-fry until browned. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add a bit more oil if needed and stir-fry the broccoli florets until tender.
Return the cooked beef to the pan, and pour the sauce over. Stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and broccoli.
Serve hot over steamed rice.

recipes.title: Chicken Parmesan
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Dip each chicken breast into beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a large ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the breaded chicken breasts and cook until golden on both sides.
Pour marinara sauce over the chicken breasts, top with shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheese.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 20 minutes.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

recipes.title: Vegetable Lasagna
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., spinach, bell peppers, mushrooms)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, sauté the minced garlic and mixed vegetables until tender.
In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta, 1 cup mozzarella, and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Season with dried basil, salt, and black pepper.
Spread a small amount of marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer with 3 cooked lasagna noodles, half of the ricotta mixture, half of the sautéed vegetables, and some marinara sauce. Repeat the layers.
Top with the remaining 3 lasagna noodles, marinara sauce, and the remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Bake in the preheated oven until bubbly and golden, about 30 minutes.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Teriyaki Salmon
ingredients: Sesame seeds and chopped green onions (for garnish)
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, minced garlic, and minced ginger to make the teriyaki sauce.
Place salmon fillets in a shallow dish and pour half of the teriyaki sauce over them. Marinate for 15 minutes.
Preheat your grill or skillet over medium-high heat. Brush with oil to prevent sticking.
Grill the salmon fillets for about 4-5 minutes per side, basting with the marinade, until cooked to your desired doneness.
Serve hot, garnished with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.

recipes.title: Garlic Butter Shrimp
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Season the shrimp with salt, black pepper, and minced garlic.
In a skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium-high heat.
Add the seasoned shrimp and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side until they turn pink and opaque.
Squeeze lemon juice over the shrimp and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat a bit of olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add fresh spinach and cook until wilted. Remove from heat and stir in crumbled feta cheese and dried oregano.
Slice a pocket into each chicken breast and stuff with the spinach and feta mixture.
Season the outside of the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
In the same skillet, heat more olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the stuffed chicken breasts and sear until golden on both sides.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Sour cream and salsa (optional, for serving)
instructions: In a skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in the taco seasoning and follow the package instructions for seasoning the beef.
Warm the taco shells or tortillas according to package instructions.
Assemble the tacos by filling each shell with seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, shredded cheddar cheese, and diced onions.
Serve with sour cream and salsa if desired.

recipes.title: Creamy Tomato Basil Soup
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and chopped onion. Sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add crushed tomatoes and fresh basil leaves to the pot. Season with salt and black pepper. Bring to a simmer.
Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Alternatively, transfer the soup to a blender to puree, then return it to the pot.
Stir in heavy cream and heat the soup until warmed through.
Serve hot, garnished with additional basil leaves if desired.

recipes.title: Beef Stroganoff
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Cooked egg noodles or rice (for serving)
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil and butter over medium-high heat. Add sliced beef and cook until browned. Remove the beef from the skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until the onion is translucent.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture and become tender.
Sprinkle flour and paprika over the mushroom mixture. Stir to combine.
Gradually pour in beef broth while stirring. Cook until the mixture thickens.
Return the cooked beef to the skillet and simmer for a few minutes.
Stir in sour cream and heat until warmed through. Season with salt and black pepper.
Serve over cooked egg noodles or rice.

recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.

Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper. In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Cook chicken until no longer pink and juices run clear, about 5 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and slice.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and sauté briefly. Pour in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens.
Toss cooked fettuccine with the Alfredo sauce. Serve topped with sliced chicken and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

recipes.title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, minced garlic, minced ginger, and cornstarch to make the sauce.
Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add thinly sliced flank steak and stir-fry until browned. Remove from the pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add a bit more oil if needed and stir-fry the broccoli florets until tender.
Return the cooked beef to the pan, and pour the sauce over. Stir-fry until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and broccoli.
Serve hot over steamed rice.

recipes.title: Chicken Parmesan
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Season the chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Dip each chicken breast into beaten egg, then coat with breadcrumbs.
In a large ovenproof skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the breaded chicken breasts and cook until golden on both sides.
Pour marinara sauce over the chicken breasts, top with shredded mozzarella and grated Parmesan cheese.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake until the cheese is melted and bubbly, about 20 minutes.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

recipes.title: Vegetable Lasagna
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., spinach, bell peppers, mushrooms)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large skillet, sauté the minced garlic and mixed vegetables until tender.
In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta, 1 cup mozzarella, and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Season with dried basil, salt, and black pepper.
Spread a small amount of marinara sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Layer with 3 lasagna noodles, half of the ricotta mixture, half of the vegetable mixture, and 1/2 cup mozzarella.
Repeat the layers, then top with the remaining 3 lasagna noodles, marinara sauce, and the remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes until bubbly and golden.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Shrimp Scampi
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season shrimp with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 2 tablespoons of butter over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and sauté briefly. Add white wine and lemon juice, and bring to a simmer. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Stir in the cooked linguine, remaining butter, and chopped parsley. Toss until the pasta is coated in the sauce.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to combine. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Mushroom Risotto
ingredients: 4 cups chicken or vegetable broth, heated
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter over medium heat. Add chopped onions and garlic, and sauté until translucent.
Add Arborio rice and cook, stirring, until the rice is slightly translucent at the edges.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it's mostly absorbed by the rice.

Begin adding the heated broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding more. Continue this process until the rice is creamy and tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender.
Remove from heat and stir in grated Parmesan cheese and remaining butter. Season with salt and black pepper.
Let it rest for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Add fresh spinach leaves and cook until wilted. Remove from heat.
Make a pocket in each chicken breast by slicing horizontally, being careful not to cut all the way through.
Stuff each chicken breast with wilted spinach, crumbled feta cheese, and chopped sun-dried tomatoes. Secure with toothpicks.
Season the stuffed chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
In an ovenproof skillet, heat a bit of olive oil over medium-high heat. Sear the stuffed chicken breasts until golden on both sides.
Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove the toothpicks before serving.

recipes.title: Pasta Primavera
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, zucchini)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook penne pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté briefly.
Add mixed vegetables and sauté until tender.
Toss cooked penne pasta with the sautéed vegetables.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and chopped fresh basil. Season with salt and black pepper.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and chopped fresh parsley. Season with salt and black pepper.
In a skillet, cook diced pancetta or bacon until crispy. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and sauté briefly.
Toss the cooked spaghetti with the egg and cheese mixture in a large bowl. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce.
Top with crispy pancetta or bacon. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Honey Garlic Shrimp
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together honey, minced garlic, and soy sauce to make the sauce.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes per side.
Pour the honey garlic sauce over the cooked shrimp and toss to coat.
Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

recipes.title: Mango Chicken Curry
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into cubes
instructions: In a large skillet, heat vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add chopped onions and minced garlic. Sauté until fragrant and onions are translucent.
Add red curry paste and cook for a minute until fragrant.
Add chicken cubes and cook until they are no longer pink.
Pour in coconut milk and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer.
Add diced mango, fish sauce, and brown sugar. Simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Serve hot over cooked rice, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves.

recipes.title: Vegetarian Chili
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and minced garlic. Sauté until onions are translucent.
Add chopped bell pepper and zucchini. Cook until they begin to soften.
Stir in black beans, kidney beans, diced tomatoes, and corn kernels.
Season with chili powder, cumin, salt, and black pepper. Simmer for about 20 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with shredded cheddar cheese, sour cream, and chopped green onions.

recipes.title: Lemon Garlic Butter Shrimp Pasta
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook linguine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season shrimp with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and 1 tablespoon of butter over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink, about 2 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and sauté briefly. Add chicken broth and fresh lemon juice, and bring to a simmer. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Stir in the cooked linguine, remaining butter, and chopped fresh parsley. Toss until the pasta is coated in the sauce.
Return the cooked shrimp to the skillet and toss to combine. Serve hot.

recipes.title: Caprese Salad
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella on a serving platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle extra-virgin olive oil over the salad.
Season with salt and black pepper.
For extra flavor, drizzle with balsamic glaze if desired.
Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add chicken breasts and cook until no longer pink and cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and sauté briefly. Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Cook for a couple of minutes.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and butter. Continue to cook, stirring, until the sauce thickens.
Slice the cooked chicken breasts and add them to the sauce. Toss to combine.
Serve the chicken Alfredo over cooked fettuccine pasta, garnished with chopped parsley.

recipes.title: Quinoa Salad with Chickpeas and Avocado
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, chickpeas, diced avocado, diced cucumber, finely chopped red onion, and chopped fresh cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together extra-virgin olive oil and lemon juice to make the dressing.
Drizzle the dressing over the salad and toss to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Serve chilled.

recipes.title: Garlic Butter Roasted Brussels Sprouts
ingredients: 1 lb Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, combine halved Brussels sprouts and minced garlic.
Drizzle melted butter and olive oil over the Brussels sprouts. Toss to coat.
Spread the Brussels sprouts on a baking sheet in a single layer.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Roast in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes or until the Brussels sprouts are tender and caramelized.
If desired, sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese before serving.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas)
instructions: In a wok or large skillet, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add minced garlic and stir-fry for about 30 seconds.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until they are tender-crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, honey, and cornstarch to make the sauce.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Lemon Herb Grilled Chicken
ingredients: 2 tablespoons fresh herbs (e.g., rosemary, thyme, oregano), chopped
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a bowl, combine lemon juice, lemon zest, minced garlic, chopped fresh herbs, olive oil, salt, and black pepper to make the marinade.

Place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over the chicken and seal the bag or cover the dish. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 15 minutes, or up to 4 hours.
Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
Remove chicken from the marinade and grill for about 6-8 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through and has grill marks.
Serve hot.

recipes.title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breast
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté briefly until fragrant.
Add fresh spinach leaves and cook until wilted. Remove from heat.
Make a pocket in each chicken breast by slicing horizontally through the thickest part of the breast, being careful not to cut all the way through.
Stuff each chicken breast with wilted spinach and crumbled feta cheese. Secure with toothpicks.
Season chicken breasts with salt and black pepper.
Place stuffed chicken breasts in a baking dish and bake in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove toothpicks before serving.

recipes.title: Homemade Margherita Pizza
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to the highest temperature it can go (usually around 500°F or 260°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
Transfer the dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange sliced tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese on top of the sauce.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 10-12 minutes or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
Remove from the oven and top with fresh basil leaves before serving.

recipes.title: Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry
instructions: In a bowl, whisk together soy sauce, brown sugar, minced garlic, and cornstarch to make the sauce.
In a large skillet or wok, heat vegetable oil over high heat.
Add thinly sliced flank steak and stir-fry until browned, about 2-3 minutes. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add broccoli florets and stir-fry for about 2-3 minutes until tender-crisp.
Return the cooked beef to the skillet and pour the sauce over the beef and broccoli. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes or until the sauce thickens.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.title: Pasta Primavera
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (e.g., bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, zucchini)
Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook penne pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add minced garlic and sauté briefly.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until they are tender-crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
Stir in cooked penne pasta and grated Parmesan cheese. Toss to combine.
Season with salt and black pepper.
Garnish with fresh basil leaves and serve.

recipes.title: Honey Mustard Glazed Salmon
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, whisk together Dijon mustard, honey, olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and black pepper to make the glaze.
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Brush the salmon fillets with the honey mustard glaze.
Bake in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Serve hot.
